Class dom.session.ViewChange 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.ViewChange
class ViewChange
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A wrapper class for the data sent in a view change (a group membership message). All this does is encapsulate all of the information needed for the group manager (server in star topology) to send group membership change information to all group members.

Package protected constructor so that only the View class can create instances (in the View.getRequestorAdmittedViewChange method).

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
getRequestorAdmittedViewChange
Source Code:
ViewChange.java

Constructor Detail

ViewChange

protected ViewChange(SessionViewID changeID,
                     boolean joining,
                     boolean successful,
                     VectorEx ids,
                     int rank,
                     SessionViewData data)
Create an instance of this wrapper class. See the View.getRequestorAdmittedViewChange method.
Parameters:
changeID - the SessionViewID of the view in question
joining - a boolean indicating if the view in question is joining (true) or leaving (false)
successful - a boolean indicating whether the view change was successful (true) or not successful (false)
ids - the VectorEx (basically a Vector) that holds all of the current SessionViewIDs for this group. This is only used so that new group members can receive the list of current group members upon successful addition to a group. Otherwise it is null.
rank - the newly added view's *rank* in the group. This is for future use, as it allows the definition of some algorithm for group manager change over time (currently we have no need to change the group manager at all dynamically, so this isn't needed).
data - the SessionViewData associated with this view change information Currently this is never used (null), but is present so that some arbitrary data could be associated with the ViewChange
See Also:
getRequestorAdmittedViewChange

ViewChange

protected ViewChange(SessionViewID changeID,
                     boolean joining,
                     boolean successful,
                     VectorEx ids,
                     int rank)
Another version of the constructor. See above.
Parameters:
changeID - the SessionViewID of the view in question
joining - a boolean indicating if the view in question is joining (true) or leaving (false)
successful - a boolean indicating whether the view change was successful (true) or not successful (false)
ids - the VectorEx (basically a Vector) that holds all of the current SessionViewIDs for this group. This is only used so that new group members can receive the list of current group members upon successful addition to a group. Otherwise it is null.
rank - the newly added view's *rank* in the group. This is for future use, as it allows the definition of some algorithm for group manager change over time (currently we have no need to change the group manager at all dynamically, so this isn't needed).
Method Detail

getChangeID

SessionViewID getChangeID()
Get the SessionViewID in question
Returns:
SessionViewID of the view that is being added/being removed from the group

isJoining

boolean isJoining()
Determine whether this is a join (true) or leave (false) change message
Returns:
true if this is a join change message, false if it is a leave change message

isSuccessful

boolean isSuccessful()
Indicate whether this the join/leave was successful (true) or not (false).
Returns:
true if view change was successful, false otherwise

getRank

int getRank()
Get the rank assigned to the newly added view. This field is irrelevant if this is not a successful join view change, or if the view change is directed to a 3rd party.
Returns:
int that indicates this new View's rank within the group. Not currently used, but could be used to allow dynamic group manager changes

getIDs

VectorEx getIDs()
Get vector of SessionViewIDs that indicate the current group membership. This is used so that the new group member can be updated by the current group manager as to what the current group membership is. This is only valid (non-null) when a group manager is sending a successful join ok message back to a putative new group member.
Returns:
VectorEx that is a Vector of SessionViewIDs that define the entire current group membership for the newly added group member

getMsgData

SessionViewData getMsgData()
Get the SessionViewData assocated with this view change. Currently not used, but potentially useful in the future for associating some data with a view change that I haven't thought of as useful yet.
Returns:
SessionViewData associated with this view change. Only the current group manager defines what this means.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Represent this view change object as a String (mostly for debugging)
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
